com.nordicid.smartpair

Class SmartPairSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nordicid.smartpair.SmartPairSettings

  • public class SmartPairSettings
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to adjust SmartPair settings. 
    
 See getSettings(), setSettings(JSONObject)d, getSettingsString(), setSettingsString(String)

 JSON structure with defaults settings:
 {
         "AutoDisconnectThresholdRssi": -60,
         "StartLookingRssi": -90,
         "ConnThresholdAdjust": 0,
         "ConnectionThresholdMap": {
             "EXA51": -40,
             "EXA31": -50
         },
         "AutoDisconnectMap": {
             "EXA51": false,
             "EXA31": false
         }
 }

 Each setting documented:

    // Automatic disconnect threshold in dBm.
    // See setAutoDisconnectThresholdRssi(int)
    "AutoDisconnectThresholdRssi": -60,

    // Start looking RSSI threshold in dBm.
    // See setStartLookingRssi(int)
    "StartLookingRssi": -90,

    // Connection RSSI threshold adjustment in dBm.
    // See setConnThresholdAdjust(int)
    "ConnThresholdAdjust": 0,

    // Device specific connection RSSI threshold in dBm.
    // See setConnThreshold(String, int)
    "ConnectionThresholdMap": {
        "EXA51": -40,
        "EXA31": -50
    },

    // Device specific auto disconnect enable state.
    // See setAutoDisconnect(String, boolean)
    "AutoDisconnectMap": {
        "EXA51": false,
        "EXA31": false
    }

    • Method Detail

      • getAutoDisconnectThresholdRssi

        public static int getAutoDisconnectThresholdRssi()
        Get automatic disconnect threshold in dBm. If connected device RSSI goes below this, connnection will be disconnected automatically. NOTE: Automatic disconnect must be enabled for connected device type. See setAutoDisconnect(java.lang.String, boolean), getAutoDisconnect(java.lang.String)
        Returns:
        Automatic disconnect RSSI threshold in dBm.

      • setAutoDisconnectThresholdRssi

        public static void setAutoDisconnectThresholdRssi(int rssiThreshold)
        Set automatic disconnect threshold in dBm. If connected device RSSI goes below this, connnection will be disconnected automatically. NOTE: Automatic disconnect must be enabled for connected device type. See setAutoDisconnect(java.lang.String, boolean), getAutoDisconnect(java.lang.String)
        Parameters:
        rssiThreshold - Automatic disconnect RSSI threshold in dBm.

      • getStartLookingRssi

        public static int getStartLookingRssi()
        Get start looking RSSI threshold in dBm. When RSSI is above this, device is considered to be near of the host device.
        Returns:
        start looking RSSI in dBm.

      • setStartLookingRssi

        public static void setStartLookingRssi(int rssiThreshold)
        Set start looking RSSI threshold in dBm. When RSSI is above this, device is considered to be near of the host device.
        Parameters:
        rssiThreshold - start looking RSSI in dBm.

      • getConnThresholdAdjust

        public static int getConnThresholdAdjust()
        Get connection RSSI threshold adjustment in dBm. This can be used e.g. when host device has bad bluetooth antenna and thus making connecting is difficult. Connection threshold adjustment is summed with device type specific connection threshold. setConnThreshold(java.lang.String, int)
        Returns:
        connection RSSI threshold adjustment in dBm.

      • setConnThresholdAdjust

        public static void setConnThresholdAdjust(int rssiAdjust)
        Set connection RSSI threshold adjustment in dBm. This can be used e.g. when host device has bad bluetooth antenna and thus making connecting is difficult. Connection threshold adjustment is summed with device type specific connection threshold. setConnThreshold(java.lang.String, int)
        Parameters:
        rssiAdjust - connection RSSI threshold adjustment in dBm.

      • getConnThreshold

        public static int getConnThreshold(java.lang.String deviceType)
        Get device specific connection RSSI threshold in dBm. Defaults: EXA31 = -50, EXA51 = -40
        Parameters:
        deviceType - Device type. Currently supported: "EXA31", "EXA51"
        Returns:
        device specific connection RSSI threshold in dBm.

      • setConnThreshold

        public static void setConnThreshold(java.lang.String deviceType,
                                    int rssiThreshold)
        Set device specific connection RSSI threshold in dBm. Defaults: EXA31 = -50, EXA51 = -40
        Parameters:
        deviceType - Device type. Currently supported: "EXA31", "EXA51"
        rssiThreshold - Connection RSSI threshold in dBm.

      • getAutoDisconnect

        public static boolean getAutoDisconnect(java.lang.String deviceType)
        Get device specific auto disconnect enable state.
        Parameters:
        deviceType - Device type. Currently supported: "EXA31", "EXA51"
        Returns:
        true if auto disconnect feature is enabled, false otherwise.

      • setAutoDisconnect

        public static void setAutoDisconnect(java.lang.String deviceType,
                                     boolean autoDiscon)
        Set device specific auto disconnect enable state.
        Parameters:
        deviceType - Device type. Currently supported: "EXA31", "EXA51"
        autoDiscon - true to enable auto disconnect feature, false otherwise.

      • setSettingsString

        public static boolean setSettingsString(java.lang.String json)
        Set all or some settings with JSON string. See JSON structure: SmartPairSettings
        Parameters:
        json - JSON formatted string
        Returns:
        true if valid json string, otherwise false

      • setSettings

        public static void setSettings(org.json.JSONObject jsonObject)
        Set all or some settings with JSON object. See JSON structure: SmartPairSettings
        Parameters:
        jsonObject - JSON object instance

      • getSettingsString

        public static java.lang.String getSettingsString()
        Get all settings as JSON string. See JSON structure: SmartPairSettings
        Returns:
        All settings as JSON string

      • getSettings

        public static org.json.JSONObject getSettings()
        Get all settings as JSON Object. See JSON structure: SmartPairSettings
        Returns:
        All settings as JSON object
